summary:
Waste management is the process of handling and disposing of different types of waste, like solid, liquid, or gases. It's crucial for keeping our environment and communities healthy. This includes collecting, transporting, and treating waste, and making sure it's done safely and legally.

Around the world, waste management methods vary. In some places, waste is properly recycled or turned into energy. However, many areas face challenges, especially in developing countries. A lot of waste is not collected or is mishandled, which can cause serious health and environmental issues. For instance, burning electronic waste releases toxic fumes. 

Effective waste management requires a combination of reducing waste, reusing items, recycling, and proper disposal.
title: Waste management
